caption: Table 1: Downstream evaluation on the nuScenes-Occupancy validation set. Based on the used train and val data, two types of settings are reported. The first is to use generated training set to augment the real training set, and evaluate on the real validation set, denoted as Aug. The second is to use pretrained models trained on the real training datasets to test on the generated validation set, denoted as Gen.
description: This table presents the results of downstream evaluation on the nuScenes-Occupancy validation set.  Two experimental setups are compared: one using a generated training set to augment the real training data (Aug), and another using models trained only on real data and tested on a generated validation set (Gen). The table shows the mean Intersection over Union (mIoU) for various semantic classes in the occupancy prediction task.  This demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed method in both data augmentation and synthetic data generation scenarios.

caption: Table 2: Comparison of FID with previous methods on the nuScenes dataset.
description: This table compares the Fréchet Inception Distance (FID) scores of different methods for image generation on the nuScenes dataset.  FID is a metric that evaluates the quality of generated images by comparing them to real images. Lower FID scores indicate higher-quality generated images.  The table shows that the proposed method (Ours) achieves the lowest FID score, indicating that it generates higher-quality images than the other compared methods. The condition type column specifies the type of input used to condition the generation process, showing different approaches for 3D geometry control.

caption: Table 3: Ablation of different designs of the MPI encoder and reweighing methods.
description: This table presents the ablation study results, showing the impact of different MPI encoder designs (3x3 conv vs. 1x1 conv) and reweighing methods (Progressive, Depth, CBGS) on the final mIoU metric.  The results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed 1x1 convolution in the MPI encoder and the combined use of progressive and depth reweighing strategies for improved performance.

caption: Table 1: Downstream evaluation on the nuScenes-Occupancy validation set. Based on the used train and val data, two types of settings are reported. The first is to use generated training set to augment the real training set, and evaluate on the real validation set, denoted as Aug. The second is to use pretrained models trained on the real training datasets to test on the generated validation set, denoted as Gen.
description: This table presents the results of downstream evaluation on the nuScenes-Occupancy validation set using two different settings. The first setting augments the real training dataset with generated data and evaluates the performance on the real validation set. The second setting uses pre-trained models on the real training data to test on a generated validation set.  The table shows the mean Intersection over Union (mIoU) for various semantic classes (barrier, bicycle, bus, car, construction vehicle, motorcycle, pedestrian, traffic cone, trailer, truck, drivable surface, other flat surface, sidewalk, terrain, man-made, and vegetation) for each method (Oracle, SytheOcc-Aug, MagicDrive, ControlNet, ControlNet+depth, and SytheOcc-Gen).

caption: Table 4: Experiments of downstream evaluation on long-tailed scenes with extreme weather.
description: This table presents the results of downstream evaluation experiments conducted on long-tailed scenes featuring extreme weather conditions.  The evaluation metric used is FB-Occ mIOU (mean Intersection over Union), which measures the performance of the occupancy prediction model.  Different weather conditions, including sandstorms, snow, fog, rain, day-night, and daytime scenarios (using raw data), are assessed, and their respective FB-Occ mIOU scores are reported. This allows for an analysis of the model's performance under various challenging real-world conditions.

caption: Table 5: Ablation of the number of multi-plane images.
description: This table shows the ablation study results on the number of planes used in the 3D semantic MPIs.  It demonstrates how the number of planes (which represents the depth resolution) impacts the performance of the FB-Occ model (measured by mIoU).  The results suggest an increase in the number of planes correlates with improved performance on the downstream occupancy prediction task.

caption: Table 1: Downstream evaluation on the nuScenes-Occupancy validation set. Based on the used train and val data, two types of settings are reported. The first is to use generated training set to augment the real training set, and evaluate on the real validation set, denoted as Aug. The second is to use pretrained models trained on the real training datasets to test on the generated validation set, denoted as Gen.
description: This table shows the downstream evaluation results on the nuScenes-Occupancy validation set using two different settings. In the first setting (Aug), a generated training set is used to augment the real training set, and the model is evaluated on the real validation set. In the second setting (Gen), pre-trained models trained on the real training dataset are tested on the generated validation set.  The results are presented as mIoU for various object categories.
